guild.description:
"For God so loved the world, that He gave His only begotten Son, that whoever believes in Him shall not perish, but have eternal life. For God did not send the Son into the world to judge the world, but that the world might be saved through Him. He who believes in Him is not judged; he who does not believe has been judged already, because he has not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God. This is the judgment, that the Light has come into the world, and men loved the darkness rather than the Light, for their deeds were evil. For everyone who does evil hates the Light, and does not come to the Light for fear that his deeds will be exposed. But he who practices the truth comes to the Light, so that his deeds may be manifested as having been wrought in God."

May all personally encounter the presence and attention of the Lord God. 

Curiosity, questions, discussion, and prayer requests are welcome.

body:
Equal but different I agree with, stay in your role I don't. Are you Baptist or something? In the Episcopal church I think it's really different. It's more like the only reason there seems like a difference between genders is because of patriarchal oppression. And so we need to give totalitarian power to the government so it can fix this (???). And the old testament is seen as mostly rubbish but we have to keep it for tradition.

Maybe I'm biased because we have a female feminist priest

I wouldn't mind trading a little of what I have for a little of what you have.

body:
It's suddenly made a comeback and they worship those old days. They call it "complementarianism" which I included on this list. They are suddenly terrified of any overlap at all between the sexes, they have to be ultra divided and different in every way, and if someone doesn't act that way it has to be corrected as soon as possible. I suppose opposites attract and since they idolize sex and marriage and raising a family as the ultimate, they want everyone to fall in line to make the "perfect" families and a "strong" society. That in itself already exposes the true motive: reproduction and propagation of the clan and species. Which means they're actually following biological instincts and using religion to justify it.

Even my own family has started dropping judgy comments any time we're in public and someone does something not typical of their gender. I never saw this before, then like a year ago it appeared out of nowhere and everyone was blindly agreeing with it.

body:
> marriage (it's important, properly understood)

It's literally treated like the ultimate purpose and if you're still not married and making babies by a certain age you're considered immature at best. For example:

"Let me tell you the most devastating attack on marriage today is coming from singleness. Singleness is an assault on marriage. Marriage is the grace of life. As a pastor, I tell my people, "Look, if it keeps going this way, I'm gonna line all the girls on one side, all the guys on the other, we're gonna just match you up and have a huge wedding." This escalating self-preoccupation, personal ambition, personal development . . . that creates a kind of terminal singleness is devastating on obviously the family. . . . I just see singleness as a disaster." - John MacArthur, the de-facto pope of Protestantism

And I can confirm seeing this attitude. The data can testify too, with people who go to church regularly marrying younger, being more likely to marry, having more kids, etc.

> historical figures

Catholic saints are included. Protestants are just as bad if not worse with the founding fathers. And both idolize philosophers and Bible characters.

> complementarianism (men and women are different, complementarianism can try to act like they're equal at times)

*Complementarianism* tries to act like they're equal? Complementarianism is the doctrine insisting men and women purposely strive to keep themselves distinct in every way and "act like their gender", and if someone has any trait at all considered more typical of the other sex then they're being a tranny, which is apparently the worst thing a person can possibly do.

> tradition (bad traditions can go, good can stay)

If it weren't an idol then people wouldn't be so attatched to the bad ones

> stoicism (some of the philosophy overlaps with Christianity I think, some doesn't seem to)

Many people value it because of the parts which are opposite of the fruits of the spirit, but appeal to human nature. Women in particular find it attractive. Coldness and ruthlessness are encouraged in a leader and equated with strength.

> strong ruthless leaders (Jesus wasn't necessarily "aggressive" but was neither excessively wrathful nor idle)

Well a lot of people talk about it constantly, and it's more common among religious folks because they can use religion to justify anything. Human nature is most comfortable with aggressive, authoritarian, and vengeful leaders. It means giving up your autonomy but you'll be safer. And you'll likely get to see your enemies suffer, which is evil af but humans absolutely love it. The vast majority of humans would choose Caesar over Jesus any day.

body:
> marriage

I understand your issue with how some people treat marriage - I was not in an environment like that, I guess because Catholicism accepts that people might become priests or nuns, and also because liberals are kind of unclear on what they believe, so it wasn't pushed on me as much, or at least I had the space to see people marry and divorce and be able to point to that as concern for rushing in to things too quickly

> complementarianism

Oh, I mean some people say that men and women are "equal", but that they are different and "complement each other". But yeah I can see where some people might "overemphasize" gender differences as well.

> stoicism

> Women in particular find it attractive.

Interesting, as I only ever see men talk about it online, but women could be putting some of those things in to practice, sure.

body:
Any hobby can become idolatry, it's just a question of what you put first in life. If it's not Christ, it's idolatry.

So a democrat (or republican) can feel patriotic but be an idolater. All they have to do is blindly believe the propaganda they are fed by fallible and corrupt humans and therefore make choices (i.e. voting) that impoverish and oppress their neighbors. That kind of faith belongs only with God.

body: While i can't really disagree with the list, my comment was meant tongue in cheek. Maybe it's just me projecting, but as i read something like this my mind wanders to examples of people in my life. Which at a certain point becomes self righteous.  Personally, it's a slippery slope to try and educate or discuss topics like this without becoming judgmental and eventually putting my mind in a place where it doesn't belong.
